description: Incorrect file permissions in BlueStacks 4 through 4.230 on Windows allow a local attacker to escalate privileges by modifying a file that is later executed by a higher-privileged user.
The server in Dundas BI through 8.0.0.1001 allows XSS via an HTML label when creating or editing a dashboard.
The server in Dundas BI through 8.0.0.1001 allows XSS via addition of a Component (e.g., a button) when events such as click, hover, etc. occur.
An XSS issue exists in the question-pool file-upload preview feature in ILIAS 6.4.
Remote Code Execution can occur via the external news feed in ILIAS 6.4 because of incorrect parameter sanitization for Magpie RSS data.

An Ubuntu-specific modification to AccountsService in versions before 0.6.55-0ubuntu13.2, among other earlier versions, improperly dropped the ruid, allowing untrusted users to send signals to AccountService, thus stopping it from handling D-Bus messages in a timely fashion.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2020-16126

description: An Ubuntu-specific modification to AccountsService in versions before 0.6.55-0ubuntu13.2, among other earlier versions, would perform unbounded read operations on user-controlled ~/.pam_environment files, allowing an infinite loop if /dev/zero is symlinked to this location.
